text: David Reeves Boggs (June 17, 1950 â€“ February 19, 2022) was an American electrical and radio engineer. He was known for creating the early versions of Internet protocols, file servers, gateways and network interface cards. With Robert Metcalfe and others, he co-invented Ethernet. Boggs died of heart failure at a hospital in Stanford, California on February 19, 2022, at the age of 71. ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Deaths from heart failure Category:American inventors Category:Engineers from Washington, D.C. Category:Engineers from California
title: David Boggs
